title: Channel Wizard
subtitle: Step-by-step messaging channel setup
telegramDesc: Create a bot via BotFather, supports DMs and groups
discordDesc: Create a Discord Bot for server channels and DMs
slackDesc: Create a Slack App for channel messages and DMs
whatsappDesc: Connect via Web protocol, dedicated number recommended
prepDesc: Complete the following steps before proceeding
telegramPrep: Open Telegram, search for @BotFather (or click the link below)
Send /newbot, follow prompts for name and username
Copy the generated Bot Token (format: digits:alphanumeric, e.g. 123456789:ABCdef-GHI)
For groups: /setprivacy ‚Üí Disable (turn off privacy mode)
‚ö†Ô∏è After disabling privacy mode, you MUST remove and re-add the Bot to the group for it to take effect
For admin features (pin/delete messages): set Bot as group admin
discordPrep: Open Discord Developer Portal ‚Üí New Application (or click the link below)
Bot ‚Üí Add Bot ‚Üí Reset Token ‚Üí Copy Bot Token (note: this is NOT the OAuth2 Client Secret)
‚ö†Ô∏è MUST enable Message Content Intent (otherwise Bot connects but reads empty message content)
Also enable Server Members Intent (if you need member lists)
OAuth2 URL Generator ‚Üí Check bot + applications.commands
Select permissions: View Channels, Send Messages, Read Message History, Embed Links, Attach Files (use Permission Calculator)
Generate invite URL and add Bot to server
Note: Bots in 75+ servers require additional Privileged Intent approval
slackPrep: Create App at api.slack.com/apps (From scratch, or click the link below)
Socket Mode ‚Üí Enable ‚Üí Generate App-Level Token (xapp-..., requires connections:write scope)
OAuth & Permissions ‚Üí Add Bot Token Scopes ‚Üí Install to Workspace ‚Üí Copy Bot Token (xoxb-...)
‚ö†Ô∏è Three different tokens: App Token (xapp-) for Socket Mode, Bot Token (xoxb-) for API calls, User Token (xoxp-) optional
Event Subscriptions ‚Üí Subscribe to message.channels, message.groups, message.im, message.mpim, app_mention
App Home ‚Üí Enable Messages Tab (otherwise users cannot DM the Bot)
Use /invite @botname to add Bot to target channels
After modifying Scopes, you must Reinstall to Workspace for changes to take effect
whatsappPrep: ‚ö†Ô∏è Gateway MUST run on Node.js (WhatsApp/Baileys is unstable on Bun, causes frequent disconnects)
Prepare a dedicated phone number (strongly recommended ‚Äî unofficial protocol carries ban risk)
Ensure the number is registered on WhatsApp and can send/receive messages
Check linked devices count (max 4 ‚Äî cannot connect if limit reached)
You will scan a QR code on your phone later (QR expires in ~20 seconds, be ready)
If connection fails, delete the session files in ~/.openclaw/sessions/ and re-scan
signalPrep: Install Java 21+ runtime (required by signal-cli ‚Äî most common failure cause)
Install signal-cli (click the link below for latest version and install instructions)
ARM Linux users may need to manually compile libsignal-client native library
Prepare a dedicated phone number (recommended ‚Äî Bot ignores its own messages to prevent loops)
Run signal-cli link, then scan QR code in phone Signal ‚Üí Settings ‚Üí Linked Devices
If signal-cli is not in system PATH, specify the full path in config
Note: Signal has strict rate limits ‚Äî bulk sending can trigger throttling
dmPolicyDesc: Control who can interact with the Bot via DMs
pairingDesc: First contact requires pairing code, most secure
allowFromPlaceholder: User ID or username, one per line
configSummary: The following will be written to openclaw.json
telegramPitfall: ‚ö†Ô∏è Common pitfalls: 1) After disabling Privacy Mode, you MUST remove and re-add the Bot to the group (official docs confirm this); 2) Bot Token format is digits:alphanumeric ‚Äî watch for extra spaces/newlines when copying; 3) Max 20 messages/minute in groups, exceeding returns 429; 4) If Webhook was previously set, call deleteWebhook before switching to polling
discordPitfall: ‚ö†Ô∏è Common pitfalls: 1) MUST enable Message Content Intent ‚Äî otherwise Bot connects but message content is empty (required since Aug 2022); 2) Bot Token ‚â† OAuth2 Client Secret ‚Äî don't confuse them; 3) requireMention must be under guilds config, top-level is ignored; 4) 75+ server Bots need Privileged Intent approval; 5) Insufficient permissions cause silent failures
slackPitfall: ‚ö†Ô∏è Common pitfalls: 1) Three tokens: App Token (xapp-) for Socket Mode, Bot Token (xoxb-) for API, User Token (xoxp-) optional; 2) App Home ‚Üí Messages Tab must be enabled or users can't DM the Bot; 3) Bot must be /invite'd to channels; 4) After modifying Scopes, must Reinstall to Workspace; 5) missing_scope = insufficient permissions
whatsappPitfall: ‚ö†Ô∏è Common pitfalls: 1) Gateway MUST run on Node.js ‚Äî Baileys is unstable on Bun with frequent disconnects; 2) Unofficial protocol carries ban risk ‚Äî use a dedicated number; 3) QR expires in ~20s, timeout requires new code; 4) Session corrupt? Delete ~/.openclaw/sessions/ files and re-scan; 5) Max 4 linked devices ‚Äî cannot connect if limit reached
signalPitfall: ‚ö†Ô∏è Common pitfalls: 1) Missing Java 21+ is the #1 failure cause; 2) ARM Linux may need manually compiled libsignal-client native lib; 3) Use signal-cli link (linked device), NOT register (new number); 4) QR in terminal needs Unicode ‚Äî may break over SSH; 5) Strict rate limits ‚Äî bulk sending triggers throttling
discordIntentWarn: Must enable Message Content Intent in Developer Portal
discordMentionWarn: requireMention must be under guilds config, top-level setting is ignored
whatsappNodeWarn: WhatsApp (Baileys) and Telegram are unstable on Bun, use Node
feishuDesc: Feishu/Lark enterprise messaging, WebSocket (no public IP needed)
dingtalkDesc: DingTalk enterprise bot, Stream mode (no public IP needed)
wecomDesc: WeCom smart bot, passive reply mode, requires public callback
wecom_kfDesc: WeCom self-built app, supports proactive messaging & media
qqDesc: QQ Official Bot API, supports DM/group/guild
feishuPrep: Install Feishu plugin: openclaw plugins install @m1heng-clawd/feishu
Sign in to Feishu Open Platform open.feishu.cn ‚Üí Create enterprise app
Copy App ID and App Secret from Credentials page
Add Bot capability in App Capabilities, set bot name
Add required permissions: im:message, im:message.p2p_msg:readonly, im:message.group_at_msg:readonly, im:message:send_as_bot, im:resource (use "Copy Permission JSON" below for batch import)

In Events & Callbacks, select "Receive events via long connection" (recommended, no public IP needed), add events: im.message.receive_v1, im.message.message_read_v1, im.chat.member.bot.added_v1, im.chat.member.bot.deleted_v1
Create and publish a version in Version Management (required after every config change)
‚ö†Ô∏è Bot can only be found in Feishu search after publishing
feishuPitfall: ‚ö†Ô∏è Common pitfalls: 1) Must add im.message.receive_v1 event in Events & Callbacks, or bot can send but won't receive messages; 2) Event subscription method must match connectionMode: Long Connection ‚Üí websocket (recommended), Request URL ‚Üí webhook; 3) Must create and publish a new version after every permission/config change; 4) Bot has no cloud storage root ‚Äî you must share folders to the bot manually for drive tools to work; 5) Windows install failure: manually download tgz and install locally
dingtalkPrep: Install DingTalk plugin: openclaw plugins install @openclaw-china/dingtalk (or full bundle @openclaw-china/channels)
In DingTalk, tap "Create or Join Organization" ‚Üí Create one (no documents needed, 5 minutes)
Sign in to DingTalk Open Platform open-dev.dingtalk.com ‚Üí Switch to the new org ‚Üí Create app
Add Bot capability in App Capabilities, message receive mode MUST be Stream (no public IP needed)
Get Client ID (AppKey) and Client Secret (AppSecret) from Credentials page
Create and publish a version in Version Management (bot appears in DingTalk search only after publishing)
(Optional) For AI Card streaming, enable Card.Instance.Write and Card.Streaming.Write permissions
dingtalkPitfall: ‚ö†Ô∏è Common pitfalls: 1) Message receive mode must be Stream, otherwise a public IP is required; 2) Must publish a version before the bot appears in DingTalk search; 3) DingTalk API has rate limits ‚Äî streaming updates can trigger throttling; 4) AI Card permissions are optional ‚Äî system falls back to plain messages if not enabled
wecomPrep: Install WeCom plugin: openclaw plugins install @openclaw-china/wecom (or full bundle @openclaw-china/channels)
Visit work.weixin.qq.com to register and sign in to WeCom admin console
In App Management ‚Üí Smart Bot, create a bot
Set callback URL: http://<your-ip-or-domain>:18789/wecom (ensure port 18789 is accessible)
Note the generated Token and EncodingAESKey (click "Random Generate")
‚ö†Ô∏è Configure OpenClaw and start the gateway FIRST, then go back to WeCom console and click "Create" ‚Äî otherwise callback verification will fail
After creation, scan QR code to add the bot and start chatting
wecomPitfall: ‚ö†Ô∏è Common pitfalls: 1) Callback URL must be publicly accessible, format: http://IP:18789/wecom; 2) Must configure OpenClaw and start gateway first, then click "Create" in WeCom ‚Äî otherwise verification fails; 3) encodingAESKey must be exactly 43 characters; 4) Ensure firewall/security group allows port 18789
wecom_kfPrep: Install WeCom App plugin: openclaw plugins install @openclaw-china/wecom-app (or full bundle @openclaw-china/channels)
Sign in to WeCom admin console work.weixin.qq.com
In App Management ‚Üí Self-built, create an app, get AgentId and Secret (corpSecret)
Get Corp ID from My Enterprise page
In app details ‚Üí Receive Messages ‚Üí Set API Receive, fill URL (http://IP:18789/wecom-app), Token, EncodingAESKey
Add server public IP to Trusted IP list
‚ö†Ô∏è Configure OpenClaw and start gateway first, then click "Save" in WeCom ‚Äî otherwise verification fails
Supports proactive messaging, image/voice/file send & receive, WeChat Work entry access
wecom_kfPitfall: ‚ö†Ô∏è Common pitfalls: 1) Must configure OpenClaw and start gateway first, then click "Save" in WeCom ‚Äî otherwise callback verification fails; 2) Must add server IP to Trusted IP list, otherwise message sending fails; 3) Token and EncodingAESKey must match WeCom console; 4) Accessible from personal WeChat via Work entry
qqPrep: Install QQ plugin: openclaw plugins install @openclaw-china/qqbot (or full bundle @openclaw-china/channels)
Visit QQ Open Platform q.qq.com ‚Üí Register developer account and complete review
Create a Bot application (not mini-program or game)
Get AppID and AppSecret from app details page
Enable permissions and add test members (optionally add bot to test group)
(Optional) For Markdown rendering, apply for Markdown template permission separately (review takes time)
qqPitfall: ‚ö†Ô∏è Common pitfalls: 1) Must enable permissions and add test members, otherwise no messages received; 2) @mention required in group chats; 3) Markdown requires separate permission ‚Äî set markdownSupport: false if not enabled; 4) QQ Bot is still in beta, some features may be limited
wechatPrep: Personal WeChat requires a third-party bridge (e.g. wechatbot-webhook)
Official account requires a verified service account on mp.weixin.qq.com
Configure server URL, Token, and EncodingAESKey
Note: Personal account stability depends on third-party tools; WeCom is recommended instead
wechatPitfall: ‚ö†Ô∏è Note: 1) Personal WeChat uses unofficial protocols ‚Äî risk of account ban, use a secondary account; 2) Official accounts need a verified service account for full API access; 3) WeCom is recommended for stability and official support
doubaoPrep: Register a developer account on Doubao Open Platform
Create an app and get credentials
doubaoPitfall: ‚ö†Ô∏è Doubao integration may change with platform updates. Refer to the latest official docs
imessagePrep: Requires an always-on Mac as iMessage server
Install BlueBubbles Server and sign in with Apple ID
For full features (Tapbacks etc.) you need to disable SIP (System Integrity Protection)
Configure BlueBubbles API address and password
imessagePitfall: ‚ö†Ô∏è Note: 1) iMessage only works via macOS ‚Äî a Mac is required; 2) Activating iMessage in a VM may fail ‚Äî start with Catalina then upgrade; 3) Disabling SIP reduces system security ‚Äî assess the risk; 4) iCloud multi-device sync may cause duplicate messages
bluebbubblesPrep: Requires an always-on Mac running BlueBubbles Server
Download and install BlueBubbles Server (see link below)
Sign in with Apple ID and ensure iMessage works
Configure connection method and API password in BlueBubbles
Private API features require disabling SIP
bluebbubblesPitfall: ‚ö†Ô∏è Note: BlueBubbles requires Mac to be always on ‚Äî power loss or sleep will interrupt messages
googlechatPrep: Requires a Google Workspace account (personal Gmail does not support Chat API)
Create a project in Google Cloud Console and enable Chat API
Create a Service Account with chat.bot scope
Get Workspace admin to approve the Chat App installation
Configure Chat App callback URL or use Pub/Sub
googlechatPitfall: ‚ö†Ô∏è Note: 1) Only Google Workspace accounts supported, not personal Gmail; 2) Requires Workspace admin approval; 3) Service Account setup is complex ‚Äî refer to official docs
msteamsPrep: Create App Registration in Azure Portal, get App ID
Create Client Secret as App Password
Enable Sideloading in Teams admin center (for testing)
msteamsPitfall: ‚ö†Ô∏è Note: 1) Azure registration has many steps ‚Äî don't confuse App ID and Client Secret; 2) Testing requires Teams admin to enable Sideloading; 3) OpenClaw MS Teams plugin required
matrixPrep: Register or deploy a Matrix Homeserver (e.g. matrix.org or self-hosted Synapse)
Create a Bot account and get Access Token (via /_matrix/client/r0/login API)
Homeserver URL must include protocol (e.g. https://matrix.org)
E2EE rooms may require additional configuration
matrixPitfall: ‚ö†Ô∏è Note: 1) Homeserver URL must include https:// prefix; 2) Access Token is obtained via API, not a password; 3) End-to-end encrypted rooms may need extra config
mattermostPrep: Create a Bot Account in Mattermost admin console
Ensure Bot is added to target channels/teams
mattermostPitfall: ‚ö†Ô∏è Note: 1) Bot must be added to target channels to send/receive messages; 2) Ensure Base URL includes protocol and port (e.g. https://mattermost.example.com:8065)
zaloPitfall: ‚ö†Ô∏è Zalo platform primarily serves the Vietnamese market, API docs are mostly in Vietnamese
voicecallPrep: Configure voice call provider (e.g. Twilio, Vonage)
Get API credentials (Account SID, Auth Token)
voicecallPitfall: ‚ö†Ô∏è Voice calls require a third-party provider and incur call charges
pluginRequired: ‚ö° This channel requires a plugin to be installed first
restartReminder: üí° Remember to restart the gateway after configuration: openclaw gateway restart
pairingGuideDesc: Configuration saved and gateway restarted. If you selected 'Pairing Mode', follow these steps:
pairingStep1: Send any regular message to the Bot (not a command)
pairingStep2: Bot will reply with a pairing code like: Pairing code: ABCD1234
pairingStep3: Enter the pairing code below and click 'Approve'
pairingCodePlaceholder: Enter the pairing code from Bot
noPrepNeeded: No preparation needed for this channel, proceed to next step
